segment.source: You can use the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) UI to create a new Windows 10 Mobile image and customize it by adding settings and some assets.
segment.target: You can use the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) UI to create a new Windows 10 Mobile image and customize it by adding settings and some assets.

segment.source: Use the Windows ICD UI to customize and build a mobile image
segment.target: Use the Windows ICD UI to customize and build a mobile image

segment.source: Use the Windows ICD UI to customize and build a mobile image
segment.target: Use the Windows ICD UI to customize and build a mobile image

segment.source: You can use the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) UI to create a new Windows 10 Mobile image and customize it by adding settings and some assets.
segment.target: You can use the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) UI to create a new Windows 10 Mobile image and customize it by adding settings and some assets.

segment.source: This imaging method requires a pre-installed OS kit so you must have all the necessary Microsoft OS packages and feature manifest files in your default install path.
segment.target: This imaging method requires a pre-installed OS kit so you must have all the necessary Microsoft OS packages and feature manifest files in your default install path.

segment.source: A configuration data file (BSP.config.xml), which contains information about the hardware component packages for your board support package (BSP), is also required.
segment.target: A configuration data file (BSP.config.xml), which contains information about the hardware component packages for your board support package (BSP), is also required.

segment.source: For the BSP.config.xml file, you can:
segment.target: For the BSP.config.xml file, you can:

segment.source: Use the BSP.config.xml file you downloaded as part of the BSP kit, or,
segment.target: Use the BSP.config.xml file you downloaded as part of the BSP kit, or,

segment.source: Generate your own BSP.config.xml by running the BSP kit configuration tools from the SoC vendor and selecting your component drivers.
segment.target: Generate your own BSP.config.xml by running the BSP kit configuration tools from the SoC vendor and selecting your component drivers.

segment.source: Build a mobile image using the Windows ICD UI
segment.target: Build a mobile image using the Windows ICD UI

segment.source: This walkthrough shows how to use the Windows ICD UI to customize, build, and flash a mobile image.
segment.target: This walkthrough shows how to use the Windows ICD UI to customize, build, and flash a mobile image.

segment.source: From the Windows ICD Start page, select New Windows image customization.
segment.target: From the Windows ICD Start page, select New Windows image customization.

segment.source: Or, you can also select New Project... from the File menu.
segment.target: Or, you can also select New Project... from the File menu.

segment.source: In the Enter Project Details window, specify a Name and Location for your project.
segment.target: In the Enter Project Details window, specify a Name and Location for your project.

segment.source: Optionally, you can also enter a brief Description to describe your project.
segment.target: Optionally, you can also enter a brief Description to describe your project.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: If you created the project from the Start page, skip this step.
segment.target: If you created the project from the Start page, skip this step.

segment.source: In the Select project workflow window, select Imaging from the list of available project workflows and then click Next.
segment.target: In the Select project workflow window, select Imaging from the list of available project workflows and then click Next.

segment.source: In the Select imaging source format window, select The Windows image is based on Microsoft packages, and then click Next.
segment.target: In the Select imaging source format window, select The Windows image is based on Microsoft packages, and then click Next.

segment.source: You will be prompted to specify a BSP.config.xml file.
segment.target: You will be prompted to specify a BSP.config.xml file.

segment.source: In the Select hardware component drivers window, click Browse to launch File Explorer and search for the location of your BSP.config.xml file.
segment.target: In the Select hardware component drivers window, click Browse to launch File Explorer and search for the location of your BSP.config.xml file.

segment.source: Click Finish.
segment.target: Click Finish.

segment.source: This loads all the customizations that you can configure based on the Windows edition that you selected.
segment.target: This loads all the customizations that you can configure based on the Windows edition that you selected.

segment.source: Once all the available customizations are loaded, you can see the Customizations Page.
segment.target: Once all the available customizations are loaded, you can see the Customizations Page.

segment.source: In the Customizations Page, select the settings you want to customize from the Available Customizations pane.
segment.target: In the Customizations Page, select the settings you want to customize from the Available Customizations pane.

segment.source: For this walkthrough, see Configure customizations in the Windows ICD UI for a list of the settings we're using as examples.
segment.target: For this walkthrough, see Configure customizations in the Windows ICD UI for a list of the settings we're using as examples.

segment.source: Once you're done configuring the settings, proceed to the next step.
segment.target: Once you're done configuring the settings, proceed to the next step.

segment.source: Although optional, export a provisioning package to encapsulate the settings you just configured and allow you to reuse all or most of the customizations for another project.
segment.target: Although optional, export a provisioning package to encapsulate the settings you just configured and allow you to reuse all or most of the customizations for another project.

segment.source: To do this, click the Export dropdown in the main menu, select Provisioning Package, add the required package information.
segment.target: To do this, click the Export dropdown in the main menu, select Provisioning Package, add the required package information.

segment.source: Name - Name to use for the package, for example, Contosoppkg.
segment.target: Name - Name to use for the package, for example, Contosoppkg.

segment.source: ID - Auto-generated package GUID.
segment.target: ID - Auto-generated package GUID.

segment.source: Owner - Package owner.
segment.target: Owner - Package owner.

segment.source: Set to OEM.
segment.target: Set to OEM.

segment.source: Version - Version info.
segment.target: Version - Version info.

segment.source: This is pre-populated with the latest package version number or "1.0".
segment.target: This is pre-populated with the latest package version number or "1.0".

segment.source: Leave it set to the default, 1.0, although you can set it to any version that you want.
segment.target: Leave it set to the default, 1.0, although you can set it to any version that you want.

segment.source: Rank - Package rank, which is a value between 0 and 99 (inclusive).
segment.target: Rank - Package rank, which is a value between 0 and 99 (inclusive).

segment.source: Leave it set to the default, 0.
segment.target: Leave it set to the default, 0.

segment.source: Click Next until you get to the Build the provisioning package screen.
segment.target: Click Next until you get to the Build the provisioning package screen.

segment.source: Click Build to build the package and then click Finish.
segment.target: Click Build to build the package and then click Finish.

segment.source: Select Create from the main menu and then choose FFU.
segment.target: Select Create from the main menu and then choose FFU.

segment.source: In the Select image type screen, choose Test for the image type.
segment.target: In the Select image type screen, choose Test for the image type.

segment.source: Although there are other image types, a Test image type is good when your image is not yet final and you are still testing various components in your image.
segment.target: Although there are other image types, a Test image type is good when your image is not yet final and you are still testing various components in your image.

segment.source: The image is also unlocked and doesn't contain any security enforcements.
segment.target: The image is also unlocked and doesn't contain any security enforcements.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: In the Describe the image screen, select the languages that you want to include as part of your image.
segment.target: In the Describe the image screen, select the languages that you want to include as part of your image.

segment.source: If you went through Part 1: Classic mobile deployment, the settings in this step are similar to how you would set the device languages in Configure the OEMInput file.
segment.target: If you went through Part 1: Classic mobile deployment, the settings in this step are similar to how you would set the device languages in Configure the OEMInput file.

segment.source: User Interface Languages - These are the display language(s) to install on the device.
segment.target: User Interface Languages - These are the display language(s) to install on the device.

segment.source: Select en-gb, en-us, es-es, fr-fr, and zh-cn.
segment.target: Select en-gb, en-us, es-es, fr-fr, and zh-cn.

segment.source: Keyboard Languages - These are additional keyboard languages to use for text correction and suggestions while typing on the device.
segment.target: Keyboard Languages - These are additional keyboard languages to use for text correction and suggestions while typing on the device.

segment.source: Select en-us.
segment.target: Select en-us.

segment.source: Speech Languages - These are the speech languages that you want to install on your device.
segment.target: Speech Languages - These are the speech languages that you want to install on your device.

segment.source: Select en-us.
segment.target: Select en-us.

segment.source: Because we selected multiple languages in User Interface Languages, we need to select the default display language that the device will use when it is first turned on by the user.
segment.target: Because we selected multiple languages in User Interface Languages, we need to select the default display language that the device will use when it is first turned on by the user.

segment.source: To do this, choose Boot Language and select the default device language that you want to set.
segment.target: To do this, choose Boot Language and select the default device language that you want to set.

segment.source: For example, set this to en-us.
segment.target: For example, set this to en-us.

segment.source: To set the country or region, choose Boot Locale and select the locale for the default region or country.
segment.target: To set the country or region, choose Boot Locale and select the locale for the default region or country.

segment.source: Any locale can be used as the regional format, but only the country (GeoID) value is used.
segment.target: Any locale can be used as the regional format, but only the country (GeoID) value is used.

segment.source: For example, set this to en-us.
segment.target: For example, set this to en-us.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: To change the location where the files are saved, click Browse... under Select where to save the files.
segment.target: To change the location where the files are saved, click Browse... under Select where to save the files.

segment.source: You may change the location where the files are saved, but typically the default location is fine.
segment.target: You may change the location where the files are saved, but typically the default location is fine.

segment.source: Optional.
segment.target: Optional.

segment.source: If you created a CAF file by following Configure customization settings, you can include this by selecting Browse... under Customization answer file (optional) and specifying the location where you saved the CAF.
segment.target: If you created a CAF file by following Configure customization settings, you can include this by selecting Browse... under Customization answer file (optional) and specifying the location where you saved the CAF.

segment.source: For example, C:ContosoCustomizationsMobileCustomizations.xml.
segment.target: For example, C:ContosoCustomizationsMobileCustomizations.xml.

segment.source: To change the default location where you want to save the image, click Browse... to launch File Explorer and specify a new location.
segment.target: To change the default location where you want to save the image, click Browse... to launch File Explorer and specify a new location.

segment.source: To use the default location, click Next.
segment.target: To use the default location, click Next.

segment.source: Click Build to start building the image.
segment.target: Click Build to start building the image.

segment.source: The project information is displayed in the build page and the progress bar indicates the build status.
segment.target: The project information is displayed in the build page and the progress bar indicates the build status.

segment.source: If you need to cancel the build, click Cancel.
segment.target: If you need to cancel the build, click Cancel.

segment.source: This cancels the current build process, closes the wizard, and takes you back to the Customizations Page.
segment.target: This cancels the current build process, closes the wizard, and takes you back to the Customizations Page.

segment.source: During the image build process, a lot of what's happening during the build process is shown in the build output window.
segment.target: During the image build process, a lot of what's happening during the build process is shown in the build output window.

segment.source: This window shows:
segment.target: This window shows:

segment.source: Warnings that might appear while the image is building.
segment.target: Warnings that might appear while the image is building.

segment.source: Verbose build messages to indicate the phases within the image build process.
segment.target: Verbose build messages to indicate the phases within the image build process.

segment.source: Error messages such as when the input files have schema errors or when the image fails to build.
segment.target: Error messages such as when the input files have schema errors or when the image fails to build.

segment.source: If your build fails, an error message will be displayed.
segment.target: If your build fails, an error message will be displayed.

segment.source: You can review the build log to identify the issue by clicking View in Notepad.
segment.target: You can review the build log to identify the issue by clicking View in Notepad.

segment.source: If your build is successful, the name of the image and its location will be displayed.
segment.target: If your build is successful, the name of the image and its location will be displayed.

segment.source: If you choose, you can build the image again by picking a different image type, selecting different languages, and then starting another build.
segment.target: If you choose, you can build the image again by picking a different image type, selecting different languages, and then starting another build.

segment.source: To do this, click Back to select what you want to change, and then click Next to start another build.
segment.target: To do this, click Back to select what you want to change, and then click Next to start another build.

segment.source: Boot the device into image or FFU download mode.
segment.target: Boot the device into image or FFU download mode.

segment.source: To force your phone into image or FFU download mode manually, press and release the power button to reboot the phone and then immediately press and hold the volume up button.
segment.target: To force your phone into image or FFU download mode manually, press and release the power button to reboot the phone and then immediately press and hold the volume up button.

segment.source: Note that this option is available only after an initial FFU has been flashed to the phone.
segment.target: Note that this option is available only after an initial FFU has been flashed to the phone.

segment.source: If this doesn't work, check and follow the device flashing instructions provided by the SoC vendor.
segment.target: If this doesn't work, check and follow the device flashing instructions provided by the SoC vendor.

segment.source: If you are ready to flash the built image to your device, click Flash and select the target device to flash the FFU.
segment.target: If you are ready to flash the built image to your device, click Flash and select the target device to flash the FFU.

segment.source: If you don't find the device listed in the list of available target device(s), click Refresh.
segment.target: If you don't find the device listed in the list of available target device(s), click Refresh.

segment.source: If you want to flash the image to the device later, follow the steps in Deploy an image to a mobile device when you are ready to flash the image to your device.
segment.target: If you want to flash the image to the device later, follow the steps in Deploy an image to a mobile device when you are ready to flash the image to your device.

segment.source: It will take a few minutes for the image to be fully flashed to the device.
segment.target: It will take a few minutes for the image to be fully flashed to the device.

segment.source: Once flashing is done, go through device setup and verify that your customizations appear as part of the image.
segment.target: Once flashing is done, go through device setup and verify that your customizations appear as part of the image.

segment.source: If you are done, click Finish to close the wizard and go back to the Customizations Page.
segment.target: If you are done, click Finish to close the wizard and go back to the Customizations Page.

segment.source: Configure customizations in the Windows ICD UI
segment.target: Configure customizations in the Windows ICD UI

segment.source: Note When configuring customizations using Windows ICD, do not use the Image time settings, use the Runtime settings instead.
segment.target: Note When configuring customizations using Windows ICD, do not use the Image time settings, use the Runtime settings instead.

segment.source: If you configure the image-time settings, this will cause an error due to a settings collision if the setting is configured in both WPAF and MCSF CAF.
segment.target: If you configure the image-time settings, this will cause an error due to a settings collision if the setting is configured in both WPAF and MCSF CAF.

segment.source: If you haven't done so already, you must first create the LayoutModification.xml files as shown in Configure the Start layout before proceeding with the steps in this section.
segment.target: If you haven't done so already, you must first create the LayoutModification.xml files as shown in Configure the Start layout before proceeding with the steps in this section.

segment.source: To configure the Start layout
segment.target: To configure the Start layout

segment.source: In the Available customizations pane in Windows ICD, expand Runtime settings, select Start, and then select StartLayout.
segment.target: In the Available customizations pane in Windows ICD, expand Runtime settings, select Start, and then select StartLayout.

segment.source: In the middle pane, click Browse to open File Explorer.
segment.target: In the middle pane, click Browse to open File Explorer.

segment.source: In the File Explorer window, navigate to the location where you saved LayoutModification1.xml from step 1; for example, C:ContosoCustomizations.
segment.target: In the File Explorer window, navigate to the location where you saved LayoutModification1.xml from step 1; for example, C:ContosoCustomizations.

segment.source: Select LayoutModification1.xml and then click Open.
segment.target: Select LayoutModification1.xml and then click Open.

segment.source: This sets the value of StartLayout and the setting should appear in the Selected customizations page.
segment.target: This sets the value of StartLayout and the setting should appear in the Selected customizations page.

segment.source: Enterprise policies and enrollment settings are some of the customizations available only through Windows Provisioning.
segment.target: Enterprise policies and enrollment settings are some of the customizations available only through Windows Provisioning.

segment.source: Here, we'll configure a few of these policies to include as part of the image.
segment.target: Here, we'll configure a few of these policies to include as part of the image.

segment.source: For more information about the other policies that you can configure, see Policies (for the Windows Provisioning settings).
segment.target: For more information about the other policies that you can configure, see Policies (for the Windows Provisioning settings).

segment.source: Note that the Windows Provisioning settings topics do not provide a detailed description of each policy; instead, each topic links to the more detailed information in Policy CSP.
segment.target: Note that the Windows Provisioning settings topics do not provide a detailed description of each policy; instead, each topic links to the more detailed information in Policy CSP.

segment.source: To set policies
segment.target: To set policies

segment.source: In the Available customizations pane, expand Runtime settings, and select Policies.
segment.target: In the Available customizations pane, expand Runtime settings, and select Policies.

segment.source: Find Policies/DeviceLock and set MaxInactivityTimeDeviceLock to "15".
segment.target: Find Policies/DeviceLock and set MaxInactivityTimeDeviceLock to "15".

segment.source: This specifies that after the device has been idle for 15 minutes, the device will become PIN or password locked.
segment.target: This specifies that after the device has been idle for 15 minutes, the device will become PIN or password locked.

segment.source: Find Policies/DeviceLock and set ScreenTimeoutWhileLocked to "15".
segment.target: Find Policies/DeviceLock and set ScreenTimeoutWhileLocked to "15".

segment.source: This specifies the duration, in seconds, for the screen timeout while on the lock screen.
segment.target: This specifies the duration, in seconds, for the screen timeout while on the lock screen.

segment.source: For this example, the duration is 15 seconds.
segment.target: For this example, the duration is 15 seconds.

segment.source: Deploy an image to a mobile device
segment.target: Deploy an image to a mobile device

segment.source: Follow these steps if you deferred flashing the image to the device after it was built.
segment.target: Follow these steps if you deferred flashing the image to the device after it was built.

segment.source: Boot the device into image or FFU download mode.
segment.target: Boot the device into image or FFU download mode.

segment.source: To force your phone into image or FFU download mode manually, press and release the power button to reboot the phone and then immediately press and hold the volume up button.
segment.target: To force your phone into image or FFU download mode manually, press and release the power button to reboot the phone and then immediately press and hold the volume up button.

segment.source: Note that this option is available only after an initial FFU has been flashed to the phone.
segment.target: Note that this option is available only after an initial FFU has been flashed to the phone.

segment.source: If this doesn't work, check and follow the device flashing instructions provided by the SoC vendor.
segment.target: If this doesn't work, check and follow the device flashing instructions provided by the SoC vendor.

segment.source: Using a USB cable, connect your phone to the host computer.
segment.target: Using a USB cable, connect your phone to the host computer.

segment.source: Click Deploy from the main menu and choose To USB connected device to deploy the FFU image to the device.
segment.target: Click Deploy from the main menu and choose To USB connected device to deploy the FFU image to the device.

segment.source: In the Select an FFU image window, click Browse... to launch File Explorer and select the FFU that you want to flash to your target device, and then click Next.
segment.target: In the Select an FFU image window, click Browse... to launch File Explorer and select the FFU that you want to flash to your target device, and then click Next.

segment.source: Choose the target device or drive from the list.
segment.target: Choose the target device or drive from the list.

segment.source: If your device or drive is not listed, click Refresh.
segment.target: If your device or drive is not listed, click Refresh.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: In the Deploy to device window, choose Flash to start flashing the image.
segment.target: In the Deploy to device window, choose Flash to start flashing the image.

segment.source: Click Finish to close the Deployment page.
segment.target: Click Finish to close the Deployment page.
